Package MathNet.Numerics.Transformations

Classes

class  ComplexFourierTransformation
 The ComplexFourierTransformation provides algorithms for one, two and three dimensional fast fourier transformations (FFT) on complex vectors.This class caches precomputations locally, thus consider reusing/caching it. More...
class  InternalFFT
 Internal FFT Implementation and Helper Function. This class caches precomputations locally, thus consider reusing it. More...
class  RealFourierTransformation
 The RealFourierTransformation provides algorithms for one, two and three dimensional fast fourier transformations (FFT) on real vectors.This class caches precomputations locally, thus consider reusing/caching it. More...

enum  TransformationConvention {
  AsymmetricScaling = 0x01, InverseExponent = 0x02, NoScaling = 0x04, Default = 0,
  Matlab = AsymmetricScaling, NumericalRecipes = InverseExponent | NoScaling, AsymmetricScaling = 0x01, InverseExponent = 0x02,
  NoScaling = 0x04, Default = 0, Matlab = AsymmetricScaling, NumericalRecipes = InverseExponent | NoScaling
}

  NoScaling = 0x04, Default = 0, Matlab = AsymmetricScaling, NumericalRecipes = InverseExponent | NoScaling

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum MathNet::Numerics::Transformations::TransformationConvention

FFT Convention.

Enumerator:
AsymmetricScaling 

Only scale by 1/N in the inverse direction; No scaling in forward direction.

InverseExponent 

Inverse integrand exponent (forward: positive sign; inverse: negative sign).

NoScaling 

Don't scale at all (neither on forward nor on inverse transformation).

Default 

Universal; Symmetric scaling and common exponent (used in Maple).

Matlab 

Only scale by 1/N in the inverse direction; No scaling in forward direction (used in Matlab). [= AsymmetricScaling].

NumericalRecipes 

Inverse integrand exponent; No scaling at all (used in all Numerical Recipes based implementations). [= InverseExponent | NoScaling].

AsymmetricScaling 

Only scale by 1/N in the inverse direction; No scaling in forward direction.

InverseExponent 

Inverse integrand exponent (forward: positive sign; inverse: negative sign).

NoScaling 

Don't scale at all (neither on forward nor on inverse transformation).

Default 

Universal; Symmetric scaling and common exponent (used in Maple).

Matlab 

Only scale by 1/N in the inverse direction; No scaling in forward direction (used in Matlab). [= AsymmetricScaling].

NumericalRecipes 

Inverse integrand exponent; No scaling at all (used in all Numerical Recipes based implementations). [= InverseExponent | NoScaling].
